long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Hey there, link builder!
How many times a day do you find yourself frantically searching for that one link you placed?

Or worse, discovering whether the blogger placed it correctly, whether it’s dofollow or nofollow, or if the page is open for indexing? 😵‍💫 Well, fret no more!

Introducing the Racoon Link Checker for link builders — your new best friend in the wild world of link building!

📌 What Racoon Link Checker does:

👉Automatically sniffs out your links: No more manual searching! Click "Scroll to link" to see where the link is placed.
👉Dofollow detective: Is it dofollow? Nofollow? Sponsored? The Racoon knows all and tells all!
👉Indexing insights: Find out if the page is indexed or if it's playing hide-and-seek with Google.
👉Google Sheets Export: Automatically export link details (page URL, date, anchor, dofollow/nofollow status) straight to Google Sheets. Perfect for organizing your link-building process.

📌How it works:

No need to enter URLs manually – the extension automatically finds and analyzes links from your chosen domains on any webpage you visit in Chrome! Get instant details on link attributes, indexing status, and more with a handy popup.

🚀 Why you'll love it:

👉Time-saver: Say goodbye to hours of manual checking. Work smarter, not harder!💡
👉Organization made easy: With automatic exports to Google Sheets, your link-building process will be smoother than a freshly paved road.
👉Stay one step ahead: Catch any sneaky changes to your links before they become a problem.
👉Perfect for link builders: Whether you're a solo link-building ninja or part of a team, this tool is your secret weapon.

📌 Features of link building tool:

👉Detects dofollow, nofollow, and sponsored attributes in links.
👉Detects noindex meta tags on pages.
👉Checks for X-Robots-Tag headers for indexing status.
👉Checks if the page is indexed in Google search results.
👉Checks Robots.txt if a page with the placed link is not closed from indexing.
👉Check if the canonical domain matches the domain in the page URL.
👉Provides options to scroll to detected links.
👉Allows copying link information to the clipboard.
👉Option to export link data to Google Sheets (when enabled).
👉Allows users to specify domains to check and exclude.
👉Allows customization of the link builder name for Google Sheets export.
👉Report. The report provides an overview of the links that you placed. Dofollow, nofollow, and sponsored type distribution.

⚙️ How to set up:

1) Click on the extension icon in your browser toolbar.
2) Select "Settings" from the popup menu.
3) On the Settings page, add the domains for links from which the extension will detect on the opened page.
4) Add domains ("Domains to Exclude" field) where the link checker extension will not check the links, for example, on your website or Ahrefs.

Enable Export to Google Sheets (Optional):

1) To use the Google Sheets export feature, click on "Export to Google Sheets Settings."
2) Follow the instructions to set up a Google Apps Script and enter the script URL in the provided field.
3) Click "Save Settings" at the bottom of the page.

So, why not let Racoon take the hassle out of link building and get back to what you do best? 🚀
